intro: Mariscus drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Mariscus drummondii is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
